project5.title: Project
project5.description: This project is an exploration into using ES6 modules. It is a site that scientists and park rangers can use to track brown bear feeding behavior.
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project4.title: Project
project4.description: project description: A good project description includes the what, the why, and the how
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project3.title: Sundews Smoozer
project3.alt: Messaging app with a sundew flower theme
project3.description: Sundew Smoozer is a messaging app that allows users to select user, send message that gets validated, delete messages, choose dark mode, adjust font-size, and clear all messages.
project3.technologiesUsed: CSS, ES6 Modules, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla), Webpack

project2.title: Compete
project2.description: Want to track statistics and see the winners? Compete is your app!  It allows park rangers to track brown bear feeding behavior, keep a record of attempts and succeses, and identify the winners. This project is an exploration into using ES6 modules. Bear-y nice!
project2.technologiesUsed: CSS, ES6 Modules, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla)

project1.title: Patient Tracker
project1.alt: Home page of the dinosaur app
project1.description: Check out this patient-tracking app for the most RAWRsome vet clinic around. This project showcases the vanilla javascript we learned during our Foundations milestone.
project1.technologiesUsed: CSS, Github (for version control), HTML, JavaScript (vanilla)
